Module com.cameronm.inventorymanager
Package com.cameronm.inventorymanager.controllers

Class ProductController

java.lang.Object
com.cameronm.inventorymanager.controllers.ProductController
public class ProductController extends Object
The ProductController class controls the logic for the Add/Modify Product window.
Since:
2023-02-03
Version:
1.0
Author:
Cameron M

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    (package private) void
    addOrModifyProduct(Product product)
    The addOrModifyProduct method initializes the values in each text field if a product was passed in, a null value is passed in if the add product button was pressed.
    private void
    initialize()
    The initialize method initializes the cancel button.
    (package private) void
    saveProduct(Product product, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> associatedPartsCopy)
    The saveProduct method uses the InventoryValidator class to check all value of the text fields to make sure they are valid, then saves a brand-new product if a null value was passed in or a product is being modified
    (package private) void
    searchAvailablePartTextFieldTyped()
    The partSearchTextFieldTyped method passes arguments to the MainController.partSearchTextField method.

  • Constructor Details

    • ProductController

      public ProductController()
      the constructor for the ProductController Class

  • Method Details

    • searchAvailablePartTextFieldTyped

      void searchAvailablePartTextFieldTyped()
      The partSearchTextFieldTyped method passes arguments to the MainController.partSearchTextField method.

    • addOrModifyProduct

      void addOrModifyProduct(Product product)
      The addOrModifyProduct method initializes the values in each text field if a product was passed in, a null value is passed in if the add product button was pressed.
      Parameters:
      product - This is the product that is selected from the product table and is being modified or null if add product button is used

    • saveProduct

      void saveProduct(Product product, javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> associatedPartsCopy)
      The saveProduct method uses the InventoryValidator class to check all value of the text fields to make sure they are valid, then saves a brand-new product if a null value was passed in or a product is being modified
      Parameters:
      product - this is the product to be modified, if a null value a passed in, a new product is created
      associatedPartsCopy - the associatedParts that are copied for the purpose of saving only if the changes are confirmed by the user

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      The initialize method initializes the cancel button.
